pullRequest.body:
- add `LinearMap.(l|r)Tensor` and their properties
- add `congr_symm`, `congr_refl_refl`, `congr_trans`, `congr_mul`, `congr_pow` and `congr_zpow`

---

nodes.body:
> But maybe it's more appropriate to introduce LinearEquiv.lTensor/rTensor.

I think you're right; let me check it later.
Ooos, file is too long :(
I have no idea why `Mathlib/Algebra/Category/ModuleCat/Monoidal/Basic.lean` breaks. Seems that `LinearMap.lTensor` does not work anymore.
It looks like that merely adding the definition `LinearEquiv.lTensor` breaks that file.

Thanks, LGTM!
maintainer merge
`(assoc R W X Y).rTensor Z` needs to be changed to `(assoc R W X Y).toLinearMap.rTensor Z`. `assoc R W X Y` was automatically coerced to a LinearMap, but now rTensor has another interpretation.

Thanks, LGTM!
maintainer merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

I think simp normal forms are the following:
```suggestion
theorem _root_.TensorProduct.coe_congr_left_refl (f : N â‰ƒâ‚—[R] P) :
    TensorProduct.congr (.refl R M) f = lTensor M (f : N â†’â‚—[R] P) :=
  rfl

theorem _root_.TensorProduct.coe_congr_right_refl (f : N â‰ƒâ‚—[R] P) :
    TensorProduct.congr f (.refl R M) = rTensor M (f : N â†’â‚—[R] P) :=
  rfl
```
But maybe it's more appropriate to introduce LinearEquiv.lTensor/rTensor.

I think this should become two lemmas: `TensorProduct.congr (.refl R M) f = f.lTensor M` and `f.lTensor M = lTensor M (f : N â†’â‚—[R] P)` (if it fails to elaborate you may add type ascription to coerce LHS to LinearMap).
I think the first is just the definition of `LinearEquiv.lTensor`, so `rw [â† LinearEquiv.lTensor]` should work. The second is `LinearEquiv.coe_lTensor` I added.

Perhaps `TensorProduct.coe_congr_left_refl` is not useful at this point, so maybe we can remove it? Since when we have `LinearEquiv.lTensor`, we don't write `TensorProduct.congr (.refl R M) f` anymore, but write `f.lTensor M` instead.

> I think the first is just the definition of LinearEquiv.lTensor, so rw [â† LinearEquiv.lTensor] should work. The second is LinearEquiv.coe_lTensor I added.

I see!

> Perhaps TensorProduct.coe_congr_left_refl is not useful at this point, so maybe we can remove it? Since when we have LinearEquiv.lTensor, we don't write TensorProduct.congr (.refl R M) f anymore, but write f.lTensor M instead.

Yeah I agree we should remove it.

```suggestion
theorem lTensor_trans_apply : (f â‰ªâ‰«â‚— g).lTensor M x = g.lTensor M (f.lTensor M x) :=
  LinearMap.lTensor_comp_apply M _ _ x

theorem rTensor_trans : (f â‰ªâ‰«â‚— g).rTensor M = f.rTensor M â‰ªâ‰«â‚— g.rTensor M :=
  toLinearMap_injective <| LinearMap.rTensor_comp M _ _

theorem rTensor_trans_apply : (f â‰ªâ‰«â‚— g).rTensor M y = g.rTensor M (f.rTensor M y) :=
```
if you like (untested)

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(FieldTheory/LinearDisjoint): definition and basic properties of linearly disjoint of fields

nodes.body:
> But maybe it's more appropriate to introduce LinearEquiv.lTensor/rTensor.

I think you're right; let me check it later.
Ooos, file is too long :(
I have no idea why `Mathlib/Algebra/Category/ModuleCat/Monoidal/Basic.lean` breaks. Seems that `LinearMap.lTensor` does not work anymore.
It looks like that merely adding the definition `LinearEquiv.lTensor` breaks that file.
`(assoc R W X Y).rTensor Z` needs to be changed to `(assoc R W X Y).toLinearMap.rTensor Z`. `assoc R W X Y` was automatically coerced to a LinearMap, but now rTensor has another interpretation.

Thanks, LGTM!
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by alreadydone.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
